title: Sinkhole swallows a BUS during the Pittsburgh morning rush-hour: Photos show nose hanging in the air
text:
Commuters in Pittsburgh were in shock this morning after a transit bus plunged into a sinkhole while waiting at a traffic light, causing injury to one passenger.

The incident occurred around 8am Monday on a 631 Bridgeville Flyer bus that displayed 'Downtown' as a destination.

Luckily only two people were on the bus; one passenger and the driver.

The 631 Bridgeville Flyer bus going 'downtown' was caught in a sinkhole on Monday morning

One passenger and the driver were on board the vehicle at Penn Ave in downtown Pittsburgh

Both managed to climb out of the vehicle and the passenger was transported to hospital to treat a minor back injury.

Images show the front of the vehicle sticking up and out the ground while the back is engulfed by the sinkhole.

A navy blue Kia is seen behind the long bus and appears to have just stopped in time to avoid falling into the hole and being completely swallowed up.

In video clips, water is seen spraying up from the ground as a result of the incident.

It's unclear what caused the sinkhole to open up nearby the David L. Lawrence Convention Center.

The Port Authority of Allegheny County explained: 'The heaviest part of the bus is the back because that's where the engine is located. This bus was stopped at a red light at the time this occurred.'

Another vehicle appears to have come dangerously close to dropping into the sinkhole

Penn Avenue was closed down between 9th and 10th as emergency services responded

Video from the scene showed water spraying up from the ground as a result of the incident

The avenue was closed down between 9th and 10th as emergency services responded.

Tow trucks were sent along and buses that use that particular stretch of Penn Ave were detoured as yellow tape was placed around the area.

Authorities were trying to figure out how to remove the bus from the sinkhole Monday morning and eventually two cranes were used to beginning the process.

Port Authority warned the extraction would take several hours and that it could shut down the area for up to 10 hours.

The car that narrowly avoided being swallowed was successfully removed.

CBS 2 reported that children attending the Small World Child Care, located along Penn Avenue, were evacuated as a precaution and taken to the nearby Westin Hotel.

Both people on the bus managed to climb out and the passenger was transported to hospital to treat a minor injury

Authorities were trying to figure out how to get the bus out of the sinkhole Monday morning
description: Authorities responded to Penn Ave and 10th with tow trucks after 8am Monday where the road had opened up as the 631 Bridgeville Flyer bus had waited a red traffic light then suddenly dropped.
